author: Emiliyan Enev
title: Build user-centric apps on Cardano
description: There is a steep learning curve to implement user-centric applications that support privacy and verifiable evidence on Cardano.

assessments.note: It's a fantastic idea and a well needed approach when smart contracts are launched in the network. Security, privacy and traceability is a key protective layer for protecting assets and identity soon to be required in the Cardano ecosystem. It is paramount that a authenticator is also deployed in the network and protective layers where Dapps can ask the user for permission and as a gatekeeper of assets in the blockchain.
Having a good sdk that works with Cardano is a very good foundation for the development of new appliations for Cardano. This is very essential.

This idea and proposal do address the challenge posed in the Developer Ecosystem challenge. The proposal would benefit from providing a greater level of detail about the current situation and about what success will look like. The amount of information provided in the fields "Problem statement: " and "Describe your solution to the problem" is small and sparse, which makes it less easy to say that the proposal "effectively" addresses the challenge. A funding proposal for USD29000 would require more information than what has been provided, in my view. So, the proposer should think of fleshing out such proposals in the future.
This proposal is not making it clear how this solution if implemented today is improving the Cardano dev ecosystem. A simple use case or metric would help make the case a lot more here.

Given the expertise presented and the experience with blockchain projects, pilots for the Dutch government and connections to possible developers in the industry it is highly likely that the proposer has the drive, knowledge and potential to implement the proposal successfully. The detailed plan shows great guidance to how it can be traced and notarized used of funds for each execution phase.

It seems that the proposer and the company have extensive experience in the field and would be able to pursue a project of this size and scope. I would have preferred if the proposer had provided specific examples in the "Relevant experience" field, instead of the generally worded: "Tens of successfully implemented blockchain projects, pilots for the Dutch government, winner in Odyssey hackathon, huge tech expertise." It is difficult to chase up such information to verify it for every proposer and as such this means that the experience as presented is not as well presented as it could have been. The implementation plan, budget and timetable seem transparent enough, although I am not an expert to assess whether they are realistic.

The team has built an sdk, other than this their project plan is very high level and hard to evaluate who will be building Cardano smart contracts, have these members used Haskell or Plutus ever? these critical points are not fully addressed as well as the lacking of implementation metrics, target dev use cases, etc.

The sdk already works for two other blockchains. Adding Cardano to the supported "backends" would be a great advantage for new projects. It would also make it quite easy to switch from etherium to cardano, if a product already used the sdk before. As the team did the same task already for two other blockchains, there is no doubt that they can do it.

The proposal meets the criteria specified. Great starting point that can be built open as new standards for all Defi/Dapps built in the Cardano network. I would advice on exploring the extra mile of multi layered approach in which a central hub similar to metamask is created and all Defi/Dapp launched in Cardano requires validation to transact, secure and trace identity and assets across the Cardano ecosystem. This can in place also allow them to also interact with each other through this platform. It is the start of a beautiful project.

In general, this proposal could have benefited from providing more information on its feasibility and how it addresses all the aspects of the Challenge Brief in much more depth to make it easier for CAs to approve it and to review it. Not in terms of ease of review, but in order to make the proposal shine among other similar proposals that are on offer.
The proposal provides lacking information and no metrics, detailed benchmark or even basic use case to describe how this solution furthers the Cardano dev ecosystem.

The sdk already works for two other blockchains. Adding Cardano to the supported "backends" would be a great advantage for new projects. It would also make it quite easy to switch from etherium to cardano, if a product already used the sdk before. As the team did the same task already for two other blockchains, there is no doubt that they can do it.

solution: Easy to use and integrate SDK that does the heavy lifting by enabling developers to add privacy, security and traceability in Cardano apps.
experience: Tens of successfully implemented blockchain projects, pilots for the Dutch government, winner in Odyssey hackathon, huge tech expertise.
